name: Canada-New Brunswick Job Grant (CNBJG)
description: Provides training grants to employers for third-party training programs that improve employee skills in areas such as leadership, technology, marketing, and project management.
requirements: Trainee must be a resident of New Brunswick, permanent Canadian citizen, or granted refugee status
Training must improve employability and value employees provide
Training programs must be delivered by accredited third-party providers
Training must start within 6 months of approval
Training must be completed within 12 months of start date

name: NRC IRAP (Industrial Research Assistance Program)
description: Provides advisory services and funding to help Canadian SMEs increase their innovation capacity and develop new products, services, or technologies through R&D activities.
requirements: Must be an incorporated, profit-oriented Canadian business
Must have 500 or fewer full-time equivalent employees
Project must involve technical uncertainty and systematic investigation
Must demonstrate innovation capacity and commercialization potential
Must maintain proper documentation of R&D activities

name: ACOA Business Development Program
description: Interest-free repayable contributions for SMEs to support business expansion, modernizing equipment, marketing initiatives, and skills development in Atlantic Canada.
requirements: Must be a for-profit business operating in Atlantic Canada
Project must demonstrate economic benefits to the region
Business must be financially viable
Must provide matching funds (typically 50% of project costs)
Must create or maintain jobs in Atlantic Canada

name: CanExport SMEs
description: Cost-sharing program providing financial assistance for export development activities to help Canadian SMEs explore and expand into new international markets.
requirements: Must be a for-profit incorporated Canadian business
Annual revenues between $100,000 and $100 million
Target market must generate less than $100,000 or 10% of total sales
Project budget must be between $20,000 and $100,000
Business must be financially stable

name: Canada Digital Adoption Program - Grow Your Business Online
description: Micro-grant to help small businesses establish or enhance their online presence through e-commerce solutions and digital marketing tools.
provider: Innovation, Science and Economic Development Canada (ISED)
requirements: Must be a for-profit business (including social enterprises and co-ops)
Must be registered or incorporated in Canada
Must sell directly to consumers
Must employ at least one person aside from owner OR report minimum $30,000 annual revenue
Must commit to maintaining digital adoption strategy for six months

name: SR&ED Tax Credit (Scientific Research & Experimental Development)
description: Tax incentive program providing refundable and non-refundable tax credits for businesses conducting R&D activities in Canada.
requirements: Must conduct systematic investigation or search in science or technology
Work must involve technological uncertainty
Must formulate hypotheses to reduce or eliminate uncertainty
Must maintain proper documentation of R&D activities
Must file SR&ED claim with annual tax return

name: Community Futures New Brunswick
description: Provides loans, training, and advisory services to rural businesses and entrepreneurs through Community Business Development Corporations (CBDCs).
requirements: Business must be located in a rural, coastal, or remote area
Must demonstrate viability and growth potential
May require personal guarantees or collateral
Business plan must be submitted
Must participate in business counseling services

name: Women Entrepreneurship Loan Fund
description: Microloans to support women-owned businesses (51%+ women ownership) to start up, scale up, and access international markets.
provider: Various regional organizations funded by ISED
requirements: Business must be 51% or more owned by women
Must demonstrate business viability
Business plan required
May require personal guarantees
Priority for underrepresented groups (Indigenous, racialized, rural, LGBTQ2S+)

name: Tourism Recovery Fund (New Brunswick)
description: Financial support for tourism and hospitality businesses to recover from economic challenges and modernize operations.
requirements: Must be a for-profit tourism business operating in New Brunswick
Must employ between 2 to 99 full-time equivalent employees
Evidence of revenue decrease (20% compared to 2019 or 10% compared to previous year)
Business must be financially viable
Must demonstrate how funds will support recovery and growth

name: New Brunswick Innovation Foundation (NBIF) Research & Development Grant
description: Funding for collaboration between small businesses and research institutions to develop innovative products or services.
requirements: Must be a New Brunswick-based small business
Must partner with accredited research institution
Project must be innovative and technology-driven
Covers up to 80% of research and development costs
Must demonstrate commercialization potential

name: Ignite Seed Grant Fund (Atlantic Canada)
description: Non-repayable seed funding for high-potential startups in Atlantic Canada for early-stage development, prototyping, and market validation.
requirements: Must be an early-stage startup or new business
Business must demonstrate high growth potential
Must be located in Atlantic Canada (Nova Scotia or New Brunswick focus)
Project must involve innovation or new technology
Business plan and pitch required

name: Green Business Initiative Grant (New Brunswick)
description: Supports businesses implementing sustainable practices, renewable energy solutions, or eco-friendly operations in New Brunswick.
requirements: Must demonstrate environmental benefits
Project must involve sustainable practices, renewable energy, or waste reduction
Must provide detailed environmental impact assessment
Matching funds may be required
Must meet provincial environmental standards

name: Youth Employment and Skills Strategy (YESS)
description: Wage subsidy to help businesses hire young Canadians (15-30 years) and provide work experience opportunities.
requirements: Must hire youth between 15-30 years old
Position must provide meaningful work experience
Minimum 6-week placement
Must pay at least minimum wage
Cannot displace existing employees

name: Canada Small Business Financing Program
description: Government-backed loan program helping SMEs access affordable financing for equipment, leasehold improvements, and real property purchases.
provider: Innovation, Science and Economic Development Canada
requirements: Must be a for-profit business operating in Canada
Gross annual revenues of $10 million or less
Loans must be used for eligible business purposes
Must work with participating financial institution
Personal guarantees typically required

name: Export Development Canada (EDC) Export Guarantee Program
description: Helps New Brunswick businesses expand into international markets by providing credit insurance and working capital solutions.
requirements: Must be a Canadian exporter or planning to export
Must demonstrate export viability
Creditworthiness assessment required
Must have international sales or contracts
Business plan for export markets required

name: Digital Transformation Grant (New Brunswick specific)
description: Funding for New Brunswick businesses to adopt digital technologies, upgrade software systems, and implement e-commerce platforms.
requirements: Must provide comprehensive digital adoption plan
Must detail intended software and technology upgrades
Covers up to 50% of eligible costs
Must implement upgrades within 12 months of receiving grant
Business must be registered in New Brunswick

name: Rural Business Development Fund (New Brunswick)
description: Supports businesses in rural New Brunswick communities to create jobs and strengthen local economies.
requirements: Business must be located in designated rural area
Must demonstrate job creation or retention
Business plan showing economic impact required
Community support letters beneficial
Must contribute to local economic diversification

name: Indigenous Business Development Program (ACOA)
description: Specialized funding for Indigenous-owned businesses and Indigenous entrepreneurs in Atlantic Canada.
requirements: Must be Indigenous-owned (First Nations, Inuit, or Métis)
At least 51% Indigenous ownership or Indigenous-led
Business must be located in Atlantic Canada
Comprehensive business plan required
Must demonstrate economic and community benefits

name: Manufacturing Innovation Fund (New Brunswick)
description: Supports New Brunswick manufacturers investing in process improvements, automation, equipment upgrades, and productivity enhancements.
requirements: Must be an established manufacturing business in New Brunswick
Project must improve productivity or competitiveness
Detailed project plan with ROI analysis required
May require matching funds
Must demonstrate job retention or creation

name: Futurpreneur Canada Startup Financing
description: Provides financing, mentorship, and support to young entrepreneurs (18-39 years) launching or growing businesses across Canada.
requirements: Must be between 18-39 years old
Must be a Canadian citizen or permanent resident
Business must be at startup or early growth stage
Comprehensive business plan required
Must participate in mentorship program for 2 years

name: Apprenticeship Job Creation Tax Credit (AJCTC)
description: Non-refundable tax credit equal to 10% of salaries and wages paid to eligible apprentices in Red Seal trades during their first two years of apprenticeship.
requirements: Must employ apprentices in prescribed Red Seal trades
Apprentice must be in first two years of registered apprenticeship contract
Apprenticeship contract registered with federal, provincial, or territorial government
Apprentice working toward certification under eligible program
Credit can be carried back 3 years or forward 20 years

name: BDC Growth Capital (Working Capital Loans)
description: Working capital loans with flexible terms to support Canadian entrepreneurs in all sectors for operational cash flow, equipment purchases, and business expansion.
requirements: Must be a Canadian business in good financial standing
Business plan demonstrating growth potential required
Loans between $100,000 and $2 million available
Flexible repayment terms with payment postponement options
May require collateral or personal guarantees

name: NRC IRAP Clean Technology Program
description: Supports Canadian clean technology businesses with development, demonstration, and commercialization of innovative environmental technologies that address climate change and sustainability.
requirements: Must be a Canadian-owned clean technology business
Technology must demonstrate significant environmental benefits
Project must be at development or demonstration stage
Must be commercializing innovative clean technologies
Covers up to 33-40% of eligible project costs

name: Canada-NB Workforce Development Agreement
description: Provides funding for skills training and workforce development programs to help New Brunswick businesses upskill employees and improve competitiveness.
requirements: Training must address specific skill gaps
Must use accredited training providers
Business must demonstrate training need
May require employer contribution to training costs
Training must lead to employability improvement

name: Atlantic Trade and Investment Growth Agreement (ATIGA)
description: Supports Atlantic Canadian businesses expanding into export markets through market development activities, trade missions, and international business development.
requirements: Business must demonstrate export readiness
Must have viable product/service for international markets
Funds for market research, trade shows, export development
Business plan for export markets required
May require matching funds

name: New Brunswick Small Business Investor Tax Credit
description: Tax credit for investors who invest in eligible New Brunswick small businesses, providing businesses access to equity capital.
requirements: Must be an active New Brunswick business
Business must have permanent establishment in NB
Gross assets under $25 million
At least 75% of employees based in New Brunswick
Cannot be publicly traded

name: Canadian Intellectual Property Office (CIPO) Patent Assistance
description: Reduced fees and assistance for small businesses applying for patents, trademarks, and intellectual property protection in Canada.
provider: Innovation, Science and Economic Development Canada
requirements: Must qualify as small entity (fewer than 50 employees)
Must be applying for Canadian patent or trademark
Eligible for reduced government fees (up to 50% discount)
Must maintain small entity status throughout application
Available for new applications and maintenance fees

name: Francophone Economic Development Fund (New Brunswick)
description: Supports Francophone-owned businesses and businesses serving New Brunswick's Francophone communities with development and expansion projects.
requirements: Business owned by Francophone entrepreneur OR serves Francophone market
Must demonstrate impact on Francophone economic development
Business plan required
Priority for businesses in Francophone regions of NB
May require matching funds

name: BDC Capital Indigenous Growth Fund
description: Provides financing and business support specifically for Indigenous entrepreneurs and Indigenous-owned businesses across Canada including New Brunswick.
requirements: Must be at least 51% Indigenous-owned or Indigenous-led
Business owner must be First Nations, Inuit, or Métis
Business plan demonstrating viability required
Available for start-up and growth-stage businesses
Advisory services and mentorship included

name: Co-operative Development Initiative (New Brunswick)
description: Supports the creation and development of co-operative businesses in New Brunswick, including worker co-ops, consumer co-ops, and multi-stakeholder co-operatives.
requirements: Must be a registered or developing co-operative structure
Demonstrates co-operative principles and values
Business feasibility study required
Priority for rural and underserved communities
Can fund feasibility studies, incorporation, and development

name: Food and Beverage Innovation Fund (New Brunswick)
description: Supports New Brunswick food and beverage businesses with product development, processing upgrades, food safety improvements, and market expansion.
provider: Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries NB / ACOA
requirements: Must be a food/beverage processing or manufacturing business
Project must improve product quality, safety, or market reach
Eligible for equipment upgrades, facility improvements
Must meet food safety and regulatory standards
May require matching investment
